thread.title: Thursday’s PrepXtra football picks: Week 7 - PrepXtra
thread.title_full: Thursday’s PrepXtra football picks: Week 7 - PrepXtra Story

author: knoxnews.com
title: Thursday’s PrepXtra football picks: Week 7 - PrepXtra
text:
Dobyns-Bennett (4-1, 2-0 Region 1-6A) at Maryville (6-0, 3-0), 7 p.m., MyVLT: Maryville received a boost last week with the return of junior running back Jordan Ervin, who rushed for 98 yards and two touchdowns on six carries in his first game since suffering a concussion against Fulton in Week 2. He also made an impact in the return game. Advantage Rebels, who are playing Dobyns-Bennett for the fifth time. Maryville has surrendered just 75 points this season, and will be favored to extend its state-best winning streak to 37 games. The Indians, coming off a bye, scraped past Hardin Valley in Week 5, forcing a safety late in the fourth quarter to edge the Hawks.
PrepXtra Pick: Maryville 35, Dobyns-Bennett 17
Jefferson County (2-3, 0-2 Region 1-6A) at William Blount (2-3, 0-2): Jefferson County and William Blount have played every year since 2009 as non-district opponents, but transitioned to Region 1-6A this season. Both need to finish with a flurry to have a chance to host a first-round playoff game in November. Expect plenty of scoring with Jefferson County’s high-powered passing attack, led by quarterback Austin Jenkins, and the dual-threat capabilities of William Blount quarterback Austin Myrick. Jefferson County leads the series 11-4.
PrepXtra Pick: Jefferson County 28, William Blount 24
Last Week: 21-7 (75 percent); Overall: 154-50 (75.5)
Nick Carboni’s Picks: Maryville over Dobyns-Bennett; Jefferson County over William Blount
Last Week: 20-8 (71.4); Overall: 148-56 (72.5)
